Package search

Class URLQueue

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
search.URLQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Remote, URLQueueInterface
public class URLQueue extends UnicastRemoteObject implements URLQueueInterface
URLQueue implements a persistent queue system for URL management in a distributed search engine. This class provides a centralized service for storing and retrieving URLs that need to be processed by web crawler components. The queue is implemented as a combination of an in-memory queue (for efficiency) and a SQLite database (for persistence). The class ensures that: 1. URLs are uniquely stored (no duplicates) 2. URLs are persisted to disk to survive system restarts 3. URLs are processed in a first-in-first-out (FIFO) manner 4. The queue can be accessed remotely via Java RMI
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • URLQueue

      public URLQueue() throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new URLQueue instance. This constructor: 1. Initializes the in-memory queue as a LinkedList 2. Establishes a connection to the SQLite database 3. Creates the URL storage table if it doesn't exist
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs during initialization

  • Method Details

    • addUrl

      public void addUrl(String url) throws RemoteException
      Adds a URL to the queue if it doesn't already exist. This method: 1. Checks if the URL is already in the in-memory queue 2. If not, adds it to both the in-memory queue and the database 3. Uses SQL's INSERT OR IGNORE to handle duplicate URLs in the database The method is synchronized to ensure thread safety when multiple clients are adding URLs concurrently.
      Specified by:
      addUrl in interface URLQueueInterface
      Parameters:
      url - The URL to add to the queue
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs

    • takeUrl

      public String takeUrl() throws RemoteException
      Retrieves and removes a URL from the queue. This method implements the following logic: 1. First attempts to take a URL from the in-memory queue 2. If the in-memory queue is empty, retrieves one URL from the database 3. Removes the URL from both the in-memory queue and the database 4. Uses a transaction to ensure database consistency The method is synchronized to ensure thread safety when multiple clients are taking URLs concurrently.
      Specified by:
      takeUrl in interface URLQueueInterface
      Returns:
      The next URL in the queue, or null if the queue is empty
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty() throws RemoteException
      Checks if the queue is empty. This method only checks the in-memory queue, not the database. For a complete check, it would need to also query the database if the in-memory queue is empty.
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface URLQueueInterface
      Returns:
      true if the in-memory queue is empty, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to initialize and run the URLQueue service. This method: 1. Creates a new URLQueue instance 2. Sets up the RMI registry on port 8184 3. Registers the URLQueue service in the registry with the name "URLQueueService"
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used)
